programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Mitch has been chosen Flash Magazine's Bachelor of the Month, a designation that leads to wild complications. Stephanie is making plans for her wedding to Tom, but her sister Caroline keeps getting in the way.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Stephanie and Tom go on their honeymoon in a two-mast schooner with a group of troubled teenagers, with Mitch and Neely along for help. All is going well until they get trapped in a hurricane and the ship starts sinking!

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Mitch gets his “15 minutes of fame” when he rescues Jay Leno from choking, and a female talk show host from drowning. Caroline and CJ adopt a stray dog swimming in the ocean that mystically reminds them of Stephanie.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: After Caroline, Neely and Manny rescue three orphan teenage boys from drowning, Caroline seeks out the enigmatic, mysterious youth who helped her rescue one of the boys. Neely's ex-husband returns, complicating her life.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Manny is haunted by his past when two juvenile delinquents from his home borough in East LA arrive at Baywatch for community service. Meanwhile, Neely suspects Mitch and Samantha are becoming more than coworkers.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: When a young couple’s romance is threatened by their parents, they make a pact to end their lives together rather than end their romance. Meanwhile, Cody encounters a mermaid while diving, and of course no one believes him… except CJ.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: While testing new scuba diving technology, Sam, Neely and Caroline witness a jet crash. They rescue the pilot, who reveals that he was transporting a canister that contains a deadly virus. Meanwhile, the team must shut down an illegal nude beach.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Caroline finds herself being sued for negligence in civil court by the angry and bitter mother of a drowning victim. CJ babysits a neighbor’s newborn and realizes she wants to be a mother. But is Cody ready to be a father?

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: CJ and Cody transport an injured sea lion to the animal recovery facility at Sea World. While there, Samantha gets the idea to promote lifeguarding by planning a Baywatch-theme stunt show at Sea World.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: A crazed young woman is causing trouble on the Venice Boardwalk and Neely suspects it is more than meets the eye. Meanwhile, Newman meets his dream woman – who doesn’t speak English.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: A mysterious, disfigured man whom the public dubs "the phantom lifeguard," is secretly saving people and sending love notes to CJ. When CJ goes missing the team sets out to find her and the “phantom.”

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Young, ambitious and sexy lifeguard candidates compete for a chance to attend Rookie School. Mitch is offered a promotion to Captain and has a tough decision to make. Lani McKensie faces the sinister return of a former lover.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Hobie, Lani, April, and Skylar are among the trainees competing for a few open slots as Baywatch Lifeguards. Hobie isn't sure he wants to follow in his father's footsteps, but when a vengeful jet skier comes after April, Hobie comes to her rescue.

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA returns to London with a stacked card featuring a showdown between top welterweights Paul “Semtex” Daley and Rory MacDonald, along with appearanc-es from Michael “MVP” Page, Cheick Kongo, Baby Slice and Liam McGeary.

programme.title: Bellator NYC: Sonnen vs Silva
programme.desc: Bellator MMA invades Madison Square Garden in NY with a blockbuster card. Chael Sonnen and Wanderlei Silva in a long-awaited grudge match. The double main event also sees Fedor Emelianenko taking on Matt Mitrione. Also, Douglas Lima and Michael Chandler!

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA is live with its biggest show ever from Madison Square Garden featuring new signee Ryan Bader taking on Champ Phil Davis for the Light Heavyweight belt. Irish phenom James Gallagher taking on KO artist Chinzo Machida.

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA takes place in Thackerville, Oklahoma with a rubber match between two veteran standouts as Brandon Girtz meets Derek Campos in a main event sure to produce fireworks! The stacked card also features fights with Joe Warren and Kendall Grove.

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA is from Verona, New York with a Middleweight showdown as Chidi Njokuani takes on former champ Andrey Koreshkov. Heavy-handed Brennan Ward will face off against Fernando Gonzalez in the co-main slot.

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA comes home to San Jose, California with a collision between top lightweights as Patricky Pitbull meets Benson Henderson. Plus the Bellator debut of Roy “Big Country” Nelson when he faces hard-hitting Javy Ayala in a heavyweight battle.

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA returns to Thackerville as Eduardo Dantas puts his Bantamweight world title on the line against Darrion Caldwell. This stacked fight card also features Daniel Straus taking on Emmanuel Sanchez and Pat Curran facing off against John Macapa.

programme.title: Bellator 185: Mousasi vs. Shlemenko
programme.desc: The elite two-division threat, Gegard Mousasi makes his Bellator debut against former Middleweight Champion Alexander Shlemenko who is on a five-fight win streak.

programme.title: Bellator MMA Full Fight Cards
programme.desc: Bellator MMA heads to Penn State as accomplished alumni Phil Davis and Ed Ruth return to their roots. Light Heavyweight Champ Ryan Bader defends his belt. Plus Ilima-Lei Macfarlane and Emily Ducote clash for the inaugural flyweight world title!

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: In 2014, former live-in nanny Diane Stretton made headlines when she refused to move out of Marcella Bracamonte's home. The women come face-to-face on Dr. Phil's stage. Who's the victim in this mother vs. nanny feud?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Tiffany & Sheka aren't alone in accusations ex-boyfriend Erik lies & scams constantly. Dr. Phil talks to ex-girlfriends Torri & Courtney & ex-wife, Martha, all sharing in Erik's deceitful behavior. Erik's revealed as an alleged con man--will he change?

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil shines a light on domestic violence speaking with Kaitlyn, defending her pro-fighter husband, Josh, while he's being held in jail without bail. And hear Trichelle, facing 20 years in prison after she says she killed her husband in self-defense.

programme.title: Dr. Phil

programme.title: Dr. Phil

programme.title: Dr. Phil

programme.title: Mentes criminales
programme.desc: La UAC se dirige a Wichita en busca de un sospechoso que secuestra niños mientras sus padres duermen. Además, Morgan está intentando averiguar quién fue el responsable del ataque.

programme.title: Mentes criminales
programme.desc: Cuando un sujeto ataca a la UAC, el equipo entra en acción para averiguar quién es el responsable.

programme.title: Mentes criminales
programme.desc: Cuando la ex miembro del equipo de la UAC y actual agente de la Interpol, Emily Prentiss localiza a un asesino en serie internacional, pide la ayuda de sus amigos de la UAC.

programme.title: NCIS: Criminología Naval
programme.desc: Mientras que el equipo de NCIS investiga el asesinato de un oficial del Mossad en Virginia, Tony y Ziva viajan a Berlín para rastrear al asesino de su padre.

programme.title: NCIS: Criminología Naval
programme.desc: Ignorando las órdenes de Seguridad Nacional, el equipo busca a Bodnar para vengar las muertes de Eli David y Jackie Vance.

programme.title: NCIS: Criminología Naval
programme.desc: Un investigador del Departamento de Defensa analiza la responsabilidad del equipo en el caso Bodnar; el equipo debe determinar si un contramaestre está sufriendo de paranoia o no al declarar que estaba siendo perseguido.

programme.title: NCIS: Criminología Naval
programme.desc: La búsqueda internacional del asesino de Eli David y Jackie Vance da un giro cuando comienza una cacería de brujas federal contra Gibbs y su equipo.

programme.title: Blue Bloods (en español): La milla extra
programme.desc: Erin y Anthony emprenden una búsqueda para encontrar a un testigo clave que huyó por miedo a represalias y convencerlo de testificar.

programme.title: Blue Bloods (en español): Boomerang
programme.desc: Estalla la indignación pública cuando no se procesa a un policía que disparó a un adolescente, afectando a Frank, el alcalde y la oficina de Erin. Danny busca al autor de un posterior tiroteo contra un oficial, posible caso de venganza.

programme.title: Blue Bloods (en español): El bien común
programme.desc: El mundo de Danny se sacude cuando Robert Lewis (Michael Imperioli), de la oficina del Fiscal General, obtiene nuevas pruebas en su contra en el caso de tiroteo en defensa propia del asesino en serie Thomas Wilder.

programme.title: Blue Bloods (en español): El precio de la justicia
programme.desc: Danny y Báez están decididos a conseguir justicia para una joven traumatizada que fue rehén, a pesar de su resistencia a presentar cargos.

programme.title: Mentes criminales
programme.desc: Cuando Morgan es secuestrado, la UAC se apresura a buscarlo y salvarle la vida.

programme.title: Mentes criminales
programme.desc: La UAC se dirige a Wichita en busca de un sospechoso que secuestra niños mientras sus padres duermen. Además, Morgan está intentando averiguar quién fue el responsable del ataque.

programme.title: Mentes criminales
programme.desc: Cuando un sujeto ataca a la UAC, el equipo entra en acción para averiguar quién es el responsable.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: Eight new competitors try and prove they are the toughest badass in the country. The winner moves on to face the Skullbuster and a chance at Steve Austin's $10,000.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: Eight hardcore athletes have come to the Broken Skull Challenge to go head to head in Rip Off, Ass Kicker and Grip & Rip. The winner goes on to face Steve's Skullbuster for a chance at $10,000.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: Another eight tough as nails women come to the ranch with one goal in mind - making it to the Skullbuster. Will the one who succeeds walk away with $10,000?

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: It's the last men's episode of the season and Steve has brought in his toughest group yet. Will one of them have what it takes to beat the Skullbuster and take home $10,000?

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The last group of eight elite female athletes comes to the ranch in search of the title of Broken Skull Ranch Champion and $10,000.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: Steve Austin hosts this bunch of 12 rough and rowdy good old boys and girls on an uninhabited paradise, as they battle each other for $100,000 in cold hard cash.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: A new redneck in peak physical condition arrives on the island challenging established relationships. The contestants are already tired of canned food, the contestants decide to hunt for an alternate protein source: LIZARD!

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: As the castaway rednecks hunt for jungle veggies, they learn that you shouldn¹t search for food in the area that used to be the latrine.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: With one team dominating, Steve makes a surprise announcement that makes tensions run high on the island; the rednecks are excited about the arrival of some new critters in the camp and must decide where they fall on the food chain.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: Redneck Island explodes with excitement when a crate of heavenly ice-cold beer washes up onshore. The party is short-lived, however, when Steve Austin informs them he has alternate plans for their precious beverage.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: The remaining rednecks decide to liven up camp-life by pulling pranks on each other, building a waterslide, and giving some of the guys their first pedicures. All the primping and fun stops when one team loses the challenge.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: The lines in the sand between the Orange and Blue teams get erased when Steve Austin makes a surprise visit to camp to announce a major shift in the competition: Contestants will now be competing individually instead of as teams.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: It is down to the final five. After a day of bowling and fishing, a sharp-shooting challenge makes one contestant safe from elimination while putting two others on the firing line.

programme.title: Redneck Island
programme.desc: With only four contestants remaining, alliances get put to the ultimate test. Meanwhile, contestants sink their teeth into their next challenge, literally, in an eating contest. The exotic fare proves challenging to stomach in many ways.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/20/2013. Anthony Bourdain visits the Johannesburg Suburb of Hillbrow, where he spends a day with a taxi driver while absorbing the culture and of course, food.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 11/03/2013. Bourdain is in search of Tokyo's dark, extreme, and bizarrely fetishistic underside. It will be surprising, and at times shocking.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: The History of Comedy

programme.title: The History of Comedy
programme.desc: Aired 8/6/2017. When it comes to parody and satire, slightly twisting something serious can turn out to be hilarious.

programme.title: The History of Comedy
programme.desc: Aired 7/30/2017. Exploring the fascinating mind of the comedian, as well as the difficult road that many seem destined to take, where mental illness and substance abuse are remarkably common.

programme.title: The History of Comedy
programme.desc: Aired 7/23/2017. Tracing the origins of topical humor from the invention of the monologue to the fake news shows of today.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A man wearing women’s underwear exposes himself. While on patrol officers question a naked man in the backseat of a vehicle who explains to officers that he’s camping. It takes several officers to take down a deranged naked man.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Officers stop a suspicious pedestrian, police and their K-9 dog search for weapons in a suspect's vehicle, and a wanted woman is stopped on a moped with her pet dog.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: An intoxicated man suspected of domestic abuse refuses to obey deputies' orders, police find drugs in a woman's car, and an alleged prostitute encounters the police.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A motorcycle with no license plate crashes while fleeing from Deputies. A woman driving a car with no windshield blames her ex-boyfriend. A gun is found hidden in a seat during a traffic stop.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Officers suspect meth use by a man sleeping in a bus station, a pedestrian's multiple bags of drugs suggest trafficking, and a drunk driver claims she was set up.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A jumpy bicyclist mistakenly reveals more than he had planned, and officers search a darkened building in an attempt to thwart a robbery in progress.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Police pursue a stolen motorcycle that turns into a foot chase. A domestic violence call results in the arrest of an abusive stepdad. Officers respond after a fight over cigarettes escalate.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A motorcyclist wanted by police hides out in his mom's garage, a man won't leave his ex-fiancee alone, and a pregnant woman gets busted for meth possession.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Spike strips are used to end a pursuit, but not before a woman falls out. A passenger flees from a stop and changes clothes. A woman from Oklahoma driving a windowless car admits to using meth.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Officers apprehend a skittish suspect, a father-to-be leads police on a foot chase, and police struggle to get the truth from a wanted man.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: An officer pursues suspects for reckless driving, police respond to the armed robbery of a pizza delivery driver, and a deputy detects a unique scent during a traffic stop.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A pair of suspects on the run pretend they were busy napping. A man reaches for something in his pocket, but denies knowing what it is. A family calls the police after their roommate brandishes a gun.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A sibling reluctantly called authorities when his belligerent brother refused to leave his mother's home. Officers respond to a shoplifting call at a local grocery store. Officers investigate a suspicious vehicle parked at a local gas station.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: An officer subdues a young man in mental duress before paramedics arrive to treat him. Officers stop a suspicious vehicle and find drug paraphernalia inside the woman's car. Officers respond to a robbery in progress.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A man with a suspended license flees a routine traffic stop on foot. Deputies respond to a battered woman after receiving a 911 hang up call. A sting operation nets a suspected drug dealer.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Detectives stop a vehicle leaving a known drug house and find a loaded concealed gun while searching one of the passengers. Local residents complain about a loud neighbor. A man is spotted walking down a road with a saw.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Police respond to a fight in progress call, officers tail a vehicle leaving a house known for drug activity, and a man calls the police after his wife pushes his Harley over.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A suspect is apprehended after trying to evade arrest, a convicted felon is detained when police make some illegal discoveries in his van, and deputies seize a repeat offender.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A man is questioned for assaulting a woman on a train. A man is arrested for burglarizing a casino, he initially denies the charges but surveillance footage corroborates. A father kicks his son out of the house after his drinking becomes problematic.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A reverse drug operation, designed to nab suspects who attempt to purchase narcotics from undercover officers, proves successful for officers in both Tampa, FL and Palm Beach County, FL. Officers are in search of a burglary suspect.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Officers apprehend an individual with a saw-like knife. A man accused of auto theft claims his girlfriend allowed him to borrow her wheels. Chiquita the chihuahua helps its owner through hard times.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A driver foot bails from a still-rolling van and hides nearby. A teen on a dirt bike refuses to stop for Deputies. A man attempts to run from a traffic stop but gets hung up on a fence.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A suspect has a change of heart after he leads police on a pursuit. An Officer discovers sterile syringes and rocks in a suspicious man's pocket after he is stopped and searched. A woman is arrested for stealing C.D's out of a car.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: A man is arrested for stealing a large amount of copper wire from a business owner. A young man on a bicycle is charged with possession of drug paraphernalia and public intoxication. A man whose tags expired by a few years is pulled over.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Officers stop a fleeing vehicle, and a man with a warrant learns that a doughnut shop is not the best place to hide from the police.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Police track a vehicle leaving a known drug house, officers sort out the facts of a domestic disturbance call, and a daughter trashes her parents' house and threatens police.

programme.title: COPS
programme.desc: Two suspects hit a car with their U-Haul truck. A suspect flees on foot after a car pursuit. An elderly man is selling fake jewelry.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A boxing champ dies in the ring after taking a brutal beating from his nemesis, but Grissom finds evidence that points to murder.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Catherine is called in by a pornographic-film developer to view graphic footage from a snuff movie in which a woman is brutally slain.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A cab driver seems to run over a boy and is then beaten to death by a mob for racial reasons.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Grissom, Warrick, and Nick investigate the case of a man who apparently was murdered and pushed off a six-story building.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Grissom and Catherine investigate the grisly meat grinder murder at a slaughterhouse.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Some bird watchers find a raven with a human eyeball in its mouth. Warrick and Grissom look into the circumstances of David's unusual and first autopsy.

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Warrick investigates the drive by murder of a young girl in his old neighborhood.

programme.title: CSI

programme.desc: Un hombre le dice a la policía que le disparó a un intruso que había atacado y asesinado a su esposa. El marido pinta un cuadro trágico y es apodado héroe.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: El mundo es un escenario
programme.desc: La policía es enviada a la escena de un tiroteo y descubren que el esposo de la víctima es uno de los suyos: un detective de homicidios que dice que su esposa se disparó accidentalmente en la cabeza.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: Emboscada en la escuela dominical
programme.desc: Cuando un hombre es asesinado a tiros en su propio garaje, la policía descubre que una herida sufrida por la afligida viuda puede haber sido autoinfligida.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: Crimen limpio
programme.desc: Una empleada de una tintorería fue violada y asesinada en la tienda. La policía recurrió a la ciencia forense en busca de las respuestas que necesitaban.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: Mientras estaba de vacaciones en California, Earl Morris se entera de que su esposa ha desaparecido de su casa en Arizona. La búsqueda de Ruby Morris involucra a decenas de investigadores y científicos – incluyendo también a la Guardia Costera.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: En 1992, Dawn Bruce, de 22 años, es brutalmente asesinada en su apartamento de Virginia. Los investigadores notan una mancha de sangre en la funda de una almohada que parece haber sido hecha por uno de los dedos del asesino.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: Durante siete años, un trío de hombres robó un banco tras otro. Siempre se escapaban antes de que llegara la policía y no dejaban pruebas.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: En la escena de un asesinato horrible, el asesino se esforzó mucho para poder borrar sus huellas dactilares y oscurecer las huellas de zapatos que dejó cuando arrastraba los rastros de sangre en el piso.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: Avis Banks y su hijo no nacido fueron brutalmente asesinados. El cuerpo fue descubierto por su prometido Keyon Pittman. La policía se enteró de que Pittman estaba teniendo aventuras con otras mujeres y se convirtió en el principal sospechoso.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: En las zonas rurales de Canadá, el Dr. John Schneeberger es acusado de sedar y agredir sexualmente a una de sus pacientes y a su hijastra. Las pruebas de ADN demuestran que el doctor es inocente, pero la paciente insiste en que la sedó y violó.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: Impresiones fuertes
programme.desc: La esposa de un oficial de la Fuerza Aérea fue encontrada muerta en su cama con una bolsa plástica de lavandería cerca de su rostro.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: En el 2004, la estudiante de enfermería Tamika Huston desapareció de su hogar en Spartanburg, Carolina del Sur. Una pista llevó a los detectives a su auto y encontraron una llave de una casa desconocida que podría ayudar a resolver el caso.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: De fotografía
programme.desc: Una adolescente de Modesto, California desapareció. No había señales de lucha en su casa y la policía sospechaba que ella simplemente se había escapado.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos
programme.desc: En 1989, April Loveless, de 4 años, fue encontrada muerta en el patio trasero de su casa en Texas. Sus padres le dijeron a la policía que fue atacada y asesinada por perros salvajes. Los investigadores no estuvieron de acuerdo.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: Rompiendo el molde
programme.desc: El hijo de tres años de unos padres de Dripping Springs, Texas, desarrolla una condición respiratoria.

programme.title: Crímenes imperfectos: Firme aquí
programme.desc: Una madre de dos hijos desaparece después de salir de compras. Su cuerpo es encontrado un mes después.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After dutifully picking up the Spirit Squad slack for a love-struck Paige all year, Manny feels betrayed when Paige claims all the glory. So Manny plots her revenge with a complicated cheer that leaves Paige with a broken leg on Prom Night.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Ashley’s leaving for the summer, and the idea of their temporary farewell and the stress of writing a song for Kevin Smith’s movie -- is making him, well, nuts. So Craig decides to do whatever it takes to follow her.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Frustrated by everything around him, Craig runs away. As he wanders the street, he befriends a young busker nicknamed, “Skinny”.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As Paige and Spinner awkwardly discuss last night's surprising kiss-fest, Darcy interrupts. She regrets their fight and breakup. But Spinner tells her he meant what he said – if Darcy can’t accept him, past and all, they're through.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Another year at Degrassi kicks off and Manny decides she’s going to be a serious actress, whatever it takes.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Manny’s still foggy on what exactly it was that happened at Peter’s party the night before. She knows she made a pretty racy video but Peter will erase everything… or so he says.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Paige has got her whole life mapped out. She plans on being accepted into the marketing program at the best university in Canada.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After all the craziness of last year, Craig has one overriding goal: no drama. He’s focused on his friends, his family, his studies, and his band – a reconstituted Downtown Sasquatch but no Spinner - a new addition is rocking the drum-kit…

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After proving he’s still got talent on the hardwood, Jimmy is invited to try out for the Wheelchair Basketball Association’s Junior Team. It’s Jimmy’s second chance at athletic stardom, and an opportunity to make his father proud.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As Liberty’s pregnancy enters its sixth month, she and JT are forced to face reality: even though no longer a couple, they have to deal with the pregnancy.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Desperate for cash, JT has stolen drugs from the pharmacy… He becomes entangled in a web between his boss, the drug dealer, and the police.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Someone’s definitely interested in Marco. But as it turns out, Tim is interested in Marco, but not for the expected reason. Tim knows Marco is gay, and has been struggling with how to come out to his friends and family.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The one-year anniversary of the school shooting is approaching and everyone’s feeling the weight of it. Not least of whom is Spinner Mason, still persona non grata.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Tonight is the premiere of “Jay and Silent Bob Go Canadian, Eh” and with many of the students and faculty on the guest list, it’s like the whole school is gripped in movie premiere fever!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Paige wakes Alex up in her bed – Paige spent the night on the floor – and as the two girls awkwardly prepare for school, they try to avoid the elephant in the room. As in, that they KISSED last night. What happened?

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Craig bursts into rehearsal with the good news – they’ve been accepted to perform at a Northern Sounds Showcase. The band is NOT so into it at first – music is Craig’s dream, not theirs.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Since being "saved" everything has been going Spinner's way: he's made a good friend in Friendship Club leader Linus; his relationship with Darcy has been going strong, and his recent interest in improving school life has been getting him noticed.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Simpson-Nelson household is in chaos. With Snake gone and Spike totally down in the dumps, keeping the household together has fallen totally onto Emma’s shoulders.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma is finally getting some control over her life. Snake and Spike are back together, she’s been running every day, and she’s barely eating.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Facing the pressure of year-end exams, the furthest thing from Marco’s mind is what happened a year ago – when Dylan stomped all over his heart. Marco takes this as a sign that he’s over Dylan for good.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The end of another school year finds Darcy’s faith – in her boyfriend – being put to the test. When she discovers that Spinner has a past, Darcy grapples with a harsh reality of teen romance: jealousy.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation

programme.title: The Making Of: Walking With Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Animatronics, computer animation and science re-create the dinosaurs' world.

programme.title: Walking With Cavemen
programme.desc: The lives of cavemen were nasty, brutish and short, but somehow they evolved over 3.5 million years into homo sapiens.

programme.title: Walking With Cavemen
programme.desc: Two very different species compete for survival in Africa 2,000,000 years ago.

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Special effects-filled documentary beginning 49 million years ago. The world is heavily forested and birds rule the planet, preying on small mammals. Whales have not yet evolved and their ancestors walk on the land.

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: A pregnant basilosaurus, an 18-metre, carnivorous whale which lives in the Tethys Sea, is forced to kill the young of a smaller whale to ensure the survival of her unborn calf.

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Going back 25 million years to the time of the indricothere, which was the largest mammal ever to live on dry land, being seven metres high and weighing 15 tons! The only threat to an adult would have been the hyaenadon which was the size of a rhino.

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: The beginnings of mankind can be traced back 3.2 million years to Ethiopia and the advent of Australopithecus, a type of ape which, like humans, was bipedal. These early members of the human family faced many dangers, including the sabre-toothed cat.

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Revealing the exotic, oversized creatures that inhabited South America one million years ago, such as the deadly smilodon, the largest of all sabre tooth cats.

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Looking at the depths of the Ice Age, following a group of mammoths who have been forced to travel south with the advent of winter. On a dangerous journey across the Alps, many become trapped in bogs or fall victim to predators.

programme.title: Walking with Monsters: Life Before Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The evolution of the predators who lived 550 million years ago, and how the first amphibians migrated from sea to land.

programme.title: Walking with Monsters: Life Before Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Three hundred million years ago, the forests were ruled by insects. This was a world in which giant dragonflies battled with two-foot-wide spiders.

programme.title: Walking with Monsters: Life Before Dinosaurs
programme.desc: On the supercontinent Pangea, early therapsids, creatures more similar to mammals than reptiles, fight for survival alongside other animals. In the carboniferous swamps, insects and arthropods take over and grow into giants.

programme.title: Science of Walking With Beasts
programme.desc: This episode explains how the 120-million-year reign of the dinosaurs ended when mammals became the fastest and fiercest creatures on the planet.

programme.title: Science of Walking With Beasts
programme.desc: A look at the science that has proved Darwin's idea that intelligent, sophisticated humans have an ancestral connection with the ape.

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The life of the first reptilian carnivores on Earth, told through computer animation.

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The Jurassic period saw the advent of the largest and strongest dinosaurs that ever roamed the Earth.

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A look at the world as it was 149 million years ago - in the late Jurassic Period. The old continents have broken up and much of the land is under water. Huge shallow seas have supported a revolution in marine life.

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: With wings longer than those of a small plane, pterosaurs were the largest creatures ever known to have flown.

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: This programme looks at the Cretaceous period, 106 million years ago. Volcanic activity forces the continents apart, and dinosaurs diversify into a range of species to cope with environmental extremes.

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: It is the late Cretaceous period and Tyrannosaurus rex is the top predator, but the Earth is poisoned by volcanic activity and a comet strikes.

programme.title: Land of Giants: A Walking With Dinosaurs Special
programme.desc: Witness the spectacle of the fearsome predator Giganotosaurus.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of Giants
programme.desc: The crew arrive in a place where everything is on a giant scale, the result of the TARDIS doors malfunctioning. They are soon made acutely aware of the nefarious plans of a ruthless businessman and his misguided scientist.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of Giants
programme.desc: The Doctor realises that the government scientist, Farrow, has been murdered while Barbara inadvertently comes into contact with the poisonous strain of insecticide.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of Giants
programme.desc: The Doctor and Susan are reunited with Ian and Barbara. As Barbara's health rapidly deteriorates, the crew find the formula for DN6, the pesticide that Forrester was prepared to kill for, and which could now be responsible for killing Barbara.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion
programme.desc: The Doctor and his companions arrive in a London very different from what they remember.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion
programme.desc: The Doctor and Ian are captured and taken to the Dalek ship.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion
programme.desc: Hiding on board the Dalek spaceship, Ian is taken to the mines of Bedfordshire.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion
programme.desc: The Doctor, Susan and David discover a nearby firebomb, left by Robomen to destroy London.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion
programme.desc: Ian and his friend Larry are chased by the Slyther, protecting the Bedfordshire mines.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion
programme.desc: Barbara realises how to control the Robomen and orders an attack on the Daleks.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Romans
programme.desc: After relaxing at a Roman villa the Doctor is mistaken for a murdered lyre player and targeted by an assassin. Meanwhile, Ian and Barbara are captured by slave traders.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Romans
programme.desc: Barbara is sold as a slave and Ian is to be trained as a gladiator. The Doctor and Vicki arrive at the Emperor’s court with the Doctor still masquerading as Maximus Pettulian.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Romans
programme.desc: Poppaea plans to poison Barbara who has become the object of Nero’s affections. The Doctor is to be thrown to the lions, Ian and Delos are set against each other in the arena.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Romans
programme.desc: Inspired by the Doctor, Nero sets Rome ablaze. Ian must fight his way out of the arena and rescue Barbara. The Doctor and Vicki hurry to flee the city and escape to the TARDIS.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Space Museum
programme.desc: The Doctor and his companions arrive on a planet which houses an all but forgotten museum. While touring it, they are horrified to discover that they themselves are exhibits in one of the cases. Can they avoid becoming just an exhibit in the space museum?

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Space Museum
programme.desc: As the Doctor and his companions move through the museum's vast labyrinth of corridors, the enslaved Xeron race sense an opportunity to topple their Morok invaders.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Space Museum
programme.desc: With the Doctor held captive by the Commander Lobos and destined to become an exhibit in the space museum, his companions are left to do whatever they can to break the chain of events.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Space Museum
programme.desc: Ian confronts Lobos and orders him to revive the Doctor as the Xerons' revolution begins to gather pace. But when the four time-travellers are re-captured, will the Doctor's prediction of a future as museum exhibits finally be realised?

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Chase
programme.desc: Ian and Vicki are trapped by tentacled creatures on the planet Aridius. The Doctor and Barbara witness Daleks leaving Skaro on a mission to eliminate the Doctor and his companions.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Chase
programme.desc: The Doctor and his friends have been given shelter from the Daleks by the Aridians. But the Daleks threaten to kill the Aridians unless they hand over the time travellers.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Chase
programme.desc: The Daleks pursue the TARDIS through time and space. In an attempt to lose the Daleks, the Doctor makes a stop on the top of the Empire State Building and then on a sailing ship.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Chase
programme.desc: With the Daleks in pursuit, the TARDIS lands in what appears to be a haunted house. When the Daleks arrive, the travellers depart, not realising that they have left Vicki behind!

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Chase
programme.desc: The Daleks follow the TARDIS to the jungle world of Mechanus which is infested with lethal plants. There the Daleks release a robot double of the Doctor that is programmed to kill.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Chase
programme.desc: The Doctor and his friends are taken prisoner by the Mechonoids. There they meet fellow prisoner, Steven Taylor. The Daleks break into the Mechonoid city and a battle commences.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Meddler
programme.desc: The TARDIS lands on the English coast in 1066, but the travellers are puzzled to find modern-day artefacts. A monk observes the arrival of the TARDIS, but seems unsurprised.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Meddler
programme.desc: The Doctor is held prisoner by the Monk in the monastery whilst Vicki and Steven search for him. Meanwhile, a Viking war party arrives ahead of the main invasion fleet.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Meddler
programme.desc: Steven and Vicki discover an atomic bazooka. It seems that the Monk has plans for the Viking invaders. Returning to the Monastery, Steven and Vicki make an amazing discovery.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Meddler
programme.desc: Discovering the Monk’s plan, the Doctor is determined to stop him meddling with history. As the Viking fleet approaches, time is running out for both the Monk and the Doctor.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A Chihuahua mix with aggression issues; a Pomeranian with severe separation anxiety; an Aussie/shar pei mix who runs away when his owner coughs.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Two wolf hybrids with aggression issues; an aggressive Chihuahua.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A basset hound is afraid of her owner's husband; a blue heeler mix with unique bedtime rituals.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A vicious Chihuahua frightens the pit bulls at the rescue center where he lives.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar Millan helps Suzie Dove Miles, who has recently adopted a Doberman who is fearful of literally everything.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Family dogs brawl with each other; a dog torments a child; a five-legged miniature pinscher has an aggressive attitude.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar attempts to introduce Roscoe, an agoraphobic Akita who is too scared to leave the house and garden and has never been for a walk, to the outside world.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A Weimaraner eats everything in sight; a yellow Lab's excess energy is expressed destructively; an Australian shepherd is unable to socialize with other dogs.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Three canines with issues at a dog-friendly ad agency office; a border collie mix becomes excited and unresponsive to commands when in her owner's truck.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Velvet Revolver drummer Matt Sorum's French bulldog goes crazy at the sight of other dogs; Cesar helps a former therapy dog with aggression issues.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A woman who has relinquished the role of pack leader to her Welsh Sealyham terrier; an English mastiff with too much energy; a Tibetan terrier who is a terror on walks.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A Great Dane with an aggressive attitude; Cesar helps a shepherd mix recover from the issues developed while living in a hoarding situation so she can be rehomed.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar adopts four puppies and films them living with him and his pack for their first eight months to demonstrate how to raise a balanced dog.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his posse head to Colorado for a special mission, to catch Marco, an alleged drug dealer. It's been ten months since Marco went on the lam, and his bondsman stands to lose his family business if Marco is not caught.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The trail is hot and the stakes is high for Dog and the posse. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond. But a major key to catching him is Elizabeth, who is also a fugitive from the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is still on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog has been tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver, and now a hot tip that a long time associate of his is hiding in Pueblo sends the team racing south.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district, moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in, it's a tough job, but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa's wedding is only three days away, but Dog is thinking about bounties, not bouquets. A hot bounty comes in and Dog wants to go on the hunt. When the ladies object, Dog explains his decision, "We're a family of hunters, we need to hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down a fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close-knit community.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again. So now the Dog, with a posse expanded to include his children and grandchildren, sets off on a hunt through the Colorado Rockies for Santa Claus himself!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam, and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address, they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address. The posse's one hope is to locate his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive, he always promises them that it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today, Dog's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills to track his prey.

programme.title: Bionic Vet

programme.title: The Litter: The Litter
programme.desc: The kittens get rambunctious and learn cat etiquette. They grow up so fast! Narrated by Khloé Kardashian.

programme.title: Animals Unleashed

programme.desc: Krystle suspects Blake's once passionate feelings for Alexis may still be lingering; Blake and Ben reach a mutual reconciliation; Amanda disappears to London; Leslie Carrington finds Ben.

programme.desc: Krystina lapses into unconsciousness, as doctors fight against time to bring her back; Krystle rebuffs Alexis' sincere concern for Krystina's health; Steven and Sammy Jo assume the appearance of a normal marriage for Danny's sake.

programme.desc: Krystina is welcomed home, following her so-far successful heart transplant; Alexis' affections are pursued by a wealthy real estate baron; convinced he is not a Carrington, Adam's life begins to crumble.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.desc: The instinct to secure a mate is one of the most powerful that there is. The lengths to which animals will go through in the search for a mate range from the beautiful to the bizarre.

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina visits Thetford Estate where she's treated to amazing photographic opportunities for her personal calendar.

programme.title: Top Dive Sites
programme.desc: Baja - Revillagigedo

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Kristina travels back to Mana Pools to experience the untamed wilderness in the extreme dry season. Her guide, Cloud, takes her on an expedition to find lion cubs and wild dog puppies. Will they find what they are looking for?

programme.title: DESTINATION CHINA
programme.desc: Yunnan 1

programme.title: EPIC SAFARI ENCOUNTERS
programme.desc: Dardley joins Kristina at Ivory Lodge on the edge of Hwange National Park where her predator sightings just keep getting better. They get unbelievably close to wild cheetah and witness something incredible.

programme.title: Nigel Marven's Cruise Ship Adventures
programme.desc: Nigel, gearing up in Buenos Aires, the tango capital, readies for an eighteen-day expedition to Antarctica. His quest: to spot wide-winged albatrosses, massive Humpback whales, Leopard seals, and charming black-and-white Gentoo penguins.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: The Hebrides - Land of Legends
programme.desc: Lying just off the coast of west Scotland, the Hebrides archipelago is made up of more than 500 islands and islets. Isolation from the mainland has made it the perfect breeding ground for millions of creatures.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Anchorage
programme.desc: This city spends most of the year encased in ice…but when summer hits, Anchorage bursts into life. Animals and plants living this far north have been forced to adapt, working faster to make the most of the short season.

programme.title: Island of the Penguins
programme.desc: In the middle of the Antarctic Ocean, an entire mountain range arises from the water: South Georgia, the nursery of the Antarctic. Hundreds of thousands of penguins, elephant seals, fur seals, and their young overcrowd the beaches.

programme.title: Zambezi Crescent
programme.desc: Moving the leadwood tree is proving to be nerve-wracking for Amanda, it isn't the heaviest tree for nothing.

programme.title: Wild Memoirs of a Film Crew
programme.desc: In this episode, the crew witness unbelievable athleticism as a lioness tackles an impala in midair. The crew share rhino incidents that were probably a bit too close for comfort. Startling encounters pursue with elephants that will never be forgotten.

programme.title: World's Wildest City: Anchorage
programme.desc: Anchorage is home to a huge number of wild porcupines, living in the city's parks, gardens, and streets. Almost twice the average size, Anchorage's porcupines search for food here in the city, and find refuge during the bitter Alaskan winters.

programme.title: Top Dive Sites
programme.desc: Raja Ampat

programme.title: The Forgotten Forests Of Malaysia
programme.desc: Malaysia boasts some of the most ancient forests on the planet. These are biological treasure troves; home to an unparalleled wealth of life.

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: We are travelling to California to start one of the longest and most impressive hiking routes in the world: the Pacific Crest Trail. A path that crosses the United States along the peaks of the West Coast from Canada to Mexico.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.desc: Whether by wing, fin or hoof, epic migrations are among nature's most awe-inspiring events. Animals undertake these arduous journeys, for many reasons: to find a mate, to give birth, or to move to new feeding grounds.

programme.title: The Wildlife
programme.desc: Episode 12

programme.title: The Rhino Orphanage
programme.desc: The poaching crisis intensifies and poachers turn their attention to orphanages. After losing her mother, four-week-old Jamila finally finds sanctuary at The Rhino Orphanage.

programme.title: 1-800-Missing
programme.desc: The team searches for an abducted newborn.

programme.title: 1-800-Missing
programme.desc: A missing boy is found after a hurricane only to turn up missing again when he is taken to a hospital overwhelmed with victims from the storm.

programme.title: Step Up: High Water
programme.desc: Tensions flare at Dondre and Janelle's over-the-top party; Johnny forces Tal to face the truth about who he is.

programme.title: Step Up: High Water

programme.desc: Sage Odom's tour auditions get underway; Uncle Al tries to save the twins; Collette and East-O's turbulent past comes to a head.

programme.desc: Realizing what it takes to become professional dance squad; Rigo has questions after Eart-o's death.

programme.title: Step Up: High Water
programme.desc: The rivalry between Tal and Zo comes to a head; Davis meets Odalie's parents.

programme.title: Greenleaf
programme.desc: Charity's plan hits a roadblock; Skip Leonard offers Jacob an enticing deal; Lady Mae suddenly finds herself at odds with the Bishop.

programme.title: Greenleaf
programme.desc: The tensions in Zora and Isaiah's relationship come to a head at the Cotillion; Lady Mae makes an overture of peace to Mavis and the result is a revelation that sends Mae into a tailspin.

programme.title: Greenleaf

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Contestants will be standing on the bottom ledge of plexiglass wall that is suspended over the water from a crane. Newlywed couples will have to tear apart a Fear Factor wedding cake filled with insects.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Contestants will be standing on a beam above the water and must make their way around the structure. Contestant will climb through a plexi-glass tunnel. A struss structure will be wrapped by cargo netting and hung beneath a 212 helicopter.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: A beam will be hung above another beam. Contestants are to devour the covered trays that conceal six different types of Fear Factor Sausage. Both team members will be seated in separate stunt cars on opposite ends of a track.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Contestants will be standing on opposite skids of the same helicopter. Contestants are hogtied with duct tape on the floor of a meat locker. Contestants will be lying on their backs in a 72-foot-long trough on the roof of a building.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Contestants will be standing on the back of the fireboat. Contestant will have the option to drink up to three habanero pepper smoothie shots. One contestant will be standing at the top of a fire slide while their partner is standing at the slide-stairs.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Two large platforms are hanging below two helicopters. In this pairs stunt, each contestant will be seated in a barber chair. Contestants will each start out straddling the side of a container, at opposite ends, high in the air.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Stunt takes place in a rectangular pig pen filled with pigs. Couple is placed back-to back and attached to an upright rotisserie. One contestant will be dragged through a field of mud.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Contestant will be locked to a net that is dangling from the cargo load ramp of a Sikorsky helicopter over the water. Contestants must make their way through a maze. Contestants must climb into the back of a car that is slowly filling with water.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Contestant is placed in a coffin, lowered into a grave, and their partner must free them. The contestants will be placed into a 7-foot deep Plexiglas tank divided into two sections and filled with water.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: For this Psycho Arc couples stunt, a hearse will be specially fabricated with a standing platform replacing the rear bumper. One contestant will be handcuffed to a shower inside a bathroom at the Bates Motel.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Team of two contestants will be in a four-walled roof-less office- type room that is filled with desks, chairs, filing cabinets, etc. Contestants will be bound in straight jackets and will have amount of time to escape.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Child contestant will be standing on top of the light tower while the parent is hanging from a helicopter. The parent contestant will be peddling a stationary bicycle. The child is standing on the roof and their parent is navigating through a maze.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Two contestants will be driving a boat down a path while connected to a helicopter. Contestants will be on their knees inside a plexiglas tank. Contestants will be standing in a plexi box that is suspended over water.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: Each couple is standing on the edge of the roof. Contestant will be sealed into a cage filled with roaches. The cage will be locked on the outside. Contestants are driving behind a flatbed and their opponents are releasing barrels to distract them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 20, 2001, Carrie Nelson was beaten to death while working alone in a park office. The case went unsolved for six years. Finally, police found a match with DNA samples gathered from the crime scene.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue — a flaw on a mailing envelope — exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1989, the dead bodies of Joan Rogers and her two teenage daughters were found floating in Tampa Bay.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young girl was discovered on isolated farmland near Delano, California. She had no ID, but police found mailbox keys in the pocket of her jeans. With no other clues, they checked the mailboxes of every apartment building in Delano.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When investigators found Bruce Miller dead in the office of his junkyard business, the crime scene was almost pristine. But when a computer forensics expert examined computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Casino security cameras tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again, but through the evidence she left behind, she was able to tell investigators what happened to her and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Soon after organizing a workers' strike, a union official is executed in his home. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood hear any gunshots. It takes a forensic sound test, an electron microscope and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Susie Mowbray was charged in her husband's death. Her son was so convinced of her innocence that he enrolled in law school, studied all of the evidence and, eventually, discovered the truth of what really happened between his parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6-year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know — without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1998, a Maryland murder mystery performance turns into a real whodunit when the badly burned body of Stephen Hricko is discovered in his hotel room.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1986, Gary Dale Larson was stabbed to death in his Edmond, Oklahoma home. The killer then sexually assaulted Larson's girlfriend, Janet Haynes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman is killed instantly when a bomb explodes in her home. The device is so powerful that it embedded shrapnel in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Young Navajos in the Southwest were dying at an alarming rate. The tribe's medicine men provided investigators with a critical clue that would lead halfway around the world to a most unlikely killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files: Within Arm's Reach

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Indiana police identified Richard Alexander as the “River Park Rapist” who assaulted four women that year. Later, DNA analysis casts doubt on his conviction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, the founder of American Atheists disappeared with one of her sons, her granddaughter and $500,000 in gold coins. The police investigated several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tries to incinerate everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently creates new forensic evidence. Detectives employ a technique never before used in a criminal investigation to bring it to light.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect falls ill and dies just before she is to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy reveals she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators must determine who had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was well liked and successful, which made the brutality of the crime even harder to understand.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1986, Gary Dale Larson was stabbed to death in his Edmond, Oklahoma home. The killer then sexually assaulted Larson's girlfriend, Janet Haynes.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: De la autora del New York Times, Caridad Piñeiro y Hallmark Publishing, llega una historia sobre quinceañeras rivales, la gloriosa cocina cubana, la amistad, los lazos familiares y el romance. Protagonizada por William Levy y Taylor Cole.

programme.title: El partido perfecto
programme.desc: Una madre soltera necesita inspiración para reinventar su restaurante en apuros. Pero cuando su ex novio de la secundaria regresa al pueblo convertido en una super estrella de béisbol, su futuro toma un nuevo rumbo.

programme.title: No hay planeación para el amor
programme.desc: Una organizadora de bodas exitosa, trabaja para convertir los sueños de las novias en realidad. En una expo de bodas salen chispas cuando Libby conoce a Ben, un asesor financiero que da consejos sobre cómo casarse a un bajo costo.

programme.title: Mi Valentín ideal
programme.desc: Después de haber perdido su empleo como presentadora de un reality show, Natalie vuelve a casa para San Valentín. Inesperadamente, se ve envuelta dirigiendo la subasta del festival local junto a su ex-prometido y sus planes toman un nuevo camino.

programme.title: Mork & Mindy

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español
programme.desc: El desafío para cada uno de los concursantes restantes es hacer un plato que se vea y sepa igual. Los expertos de la revista 'Bon Appetit' ayudan al Chef Ramsay a juzgar.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español
programme.desc: Los participantes conocen una versión en miniatura del Chef Ramsay: el actor y chico impresionista británico Felix Light. Deben preparar comidas sin carne para él y otros ochenta jóvenes.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español
programme.desc: En la primera parte del final de temporada, los tres concursantes restantes deberán preparar un plato con ingredientes de todo el mundo. Los jueces son un grupo de expertos culinarios internacionales.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español
programme.desc: En la parte final del final de temporada, los Chefs finales deben preparar platos dignos de Araxi, el restaurante y bar de ostras donde el ganador será el Chef.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día uno
programme.desc: Doce chefs compiten para impresionar a Gordon Ramsay. Ellos trabajan para abrir un renombrado restaurante en Los Ángeles. Ahí se descubre la próxima estrella culinaria.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día dos
programme.desc: Después de apenas sobrevivir la noche de apertura del restaurante Hell's Kitchen, los concursantes se preparan para su segundo servicio de cena.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día tres
programme.desc: Los chefs se preparan para su tercer servicio de cena, pero la presión de Hell's Kitchen es demasiado para un concursante.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día cuatro
programme.desc: Los concursantes intentan recrear los platos característicos de Gordon para un público exigente de Los Ángeles.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día cinco
programme.desc: Las tensiones surgen en la cocina durante la noche italiana. En el restaurante hay un equipo que quiere ganar jugando sucio.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día seis
programme.desc: En la primera mitad de este especial de dos horas, el chef Ramsay revela el último giro: cada equipo creará su propio menú que consta de tres aperitivos, platos principales y postres.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día siete
programme.desc: En la parte final de este especial de dos horas, los cinco concursantes restantes descubren que ya no compiten como equipos, sino como individuos.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día ocho
programme.desc: Los cuatro chefs restantes reciben quince minutos y una bandeja con sobras para crear una comida que el chef Ramsay considera servible.

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día nueve
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay ordena a los tres concursantes restantes que sirvan una cena completa. ¿Quién creará el mejor plato y quién será enviado a casa sin postre?

programme.title: Hell’s Kitchen en español: Día diez
programme.desc: En el final de temporada, los dos finalistas, con la ayuda de los chefs eliminados, compiten en una simulación que pone a prueba sus habilidades para administrar un restaurante.

programme.desc: Get closer to nature and deepen your understanding of our complex natural world. Filmed in the highest quality, Love Nature offers viewers powerful stories of nature's beauty and wonder from around the globe.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: Bighorn rams rattle the mountaintops; Brown bears battle, desperate to fatten up for winter; Sharp-tailed grouse shake their tail-feathers; Wild stallions rumble with beauty and grace.

programme.title: Macaque Island
programme.desc: Exploreing the captivating cityscape, where Matnoor rules over the 30-member-strong Street Troop, before meeting the wilder Hill Troop's old alpha, Aarav.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild
programme.desc: Southern muriqui, Dora, takes her first steps away from her mom, Mimi; exploring spider monkey troop dynamics and tail-hanging technique.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: How elephants dig wells; a sudden river-filling downpour; cheetah Kuleta loses one of her cubs to lions; wild dog Phoenix faces off with a hyena mob.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: The Great Elephant Tale follows three stories: a calf navigates the Okavango Delta; a bull searches for a mate; and a matriarch leads her family through the desert. These individual adventures tell the story of Africa's most iconic species.

programme.title: Dawn to Dusk
programme.desc: Mother's day means the beginning of the dry season in Sri-Lanka and the end of it in India.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Returning to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi and the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs; yearling Snowy faces a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Weka's pups and leaves her frantically searching for them.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: There's a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack, who are missing four of their precious pups; Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Programme is on a house call to the Kakumbi den, where another pup has gone AWOL.

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild
programme.desc: Sea lion Lola take her first chaotic steps into a macho battlefield on Argentina's coast; this baby learns key vocal and swimming skills, fights to stay by mom Maria's side, and makes a lightning-fast escape from the jaws of death.

programme.title: A Cheetah's Pride
programme.desc: It's a cold winter morning, the sun is just rising when the two cheetah families meet; Chilli with her five cubs and Inara trailed by her four; a confrontation ensues.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Queen Gretchen of the Kingdom of Monaka dies from a car accident. As a fan of her years as a Hollywood actress, Lupin mourns her passing.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Once a year, jewelers from around the country descend on New York City for a jewelry tradeshow, bringing with them their entire inventory. Combined, the jewelry is said to be worth 20 million dollars.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang have Pinkerton's unbreakable safe, minus the key. Lupin breaks into the prison where the late Pinkerton was once held and finds the key hidden in his former prison cell. Now the gang has both the safe and key.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: At Fujiko's request, Lupin steals the Hina dolls given to the US Vice President by the Deputy Prime Minister of Japan. However, the doll heist was a trap laid out by Fujiko and her partner, Barracuda.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Goemon pities the young boy who is afflicted with an incurable illness and swears to retrieve his father's painting for him. Will Goemon be able to keep his promise and will Lupin decipher the painting's hidden secret?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: The 100-carat blue diamond, known as Hades' Tear is auctioned off at 1 billion dollars along with its accompanying Hades statue to the KL Foundation of Kingsland. Lupin and Jigen make off with Hades' Tear with ease, but they find out it's only glass.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Mexico's richest woman, Madame Tequila owns a black diamond named the Black Pig of Mexico. Realizing that Lupin is after her diamond, Madame Tequila appoints Inspector Zenigata to guard it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang steal the Ivanov, the Soviet Union's newest atomic submarine from the Port of Arkhangelsk. Lupin becomes entangled in a fierce tug of war between the KGB and CIA when Fujiko decides to sell it to the highest bidder.

programme.title: LUPIN THE 3rd TVSP #9 Islands of Assasins
programme.desc: The den of the deadly Tarantulas gang, this island is the most dangerous place on Earth… and Lupin's right in the middle of it! A dark mystery haunts his past, and the key to it is on the island.

programme.title: LUPIN THE 3rd TVSP #10 Tokyo Crisis
programme.desc: When Lupin and his bandit buddies attempt to steal a set of historically significant photographic plates, it turns out they're not the only ones with eyes on the prize in this thievish tale of mayhem and millionaires.

programme.title: LUPIN THE 3rd TVSP #11 The Columbus Files
programme.desc: Lupin and Fujiko are after the mysterious treasure known only as Columbus' Egg. Fujiko was able to memorize the Egg's location, but when she's attacked and loses her memory, all seems lost. No one else knows where it is. What's a thief to do?

programme.title: LUPIN THE 3rd TVSP #12 Missed by a Dollar
programme.desc: At an auction in New York, attendees are shocked when a mysterious man bids $1,000,000 on a plain diamond ring. The man himself is even more astounded when the President of the World Bank outbids him by a single dollar. The man is Lupin!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 4
programme.desc: Inspector Zenigata arrives in San Marino after receiving a note from Lupin III. Instead of a declaration of a new theft, it's a wedding invitation.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 4
programme.desc: Marlow Brozzi, a soccer player from San Marino. A mafia member has proof that Brozzi is cheating so Brozzi approaches Lupin for help.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 4
programme.desc: Lupin and the gang managed to steal a fragment of Marie Antoinette's necklace, but Jigen has been captured by Nyx.

programme.title: La vida moderna de Rocko

programme.title: La vida moderna de Rocko

programme.title: El show de Jerry Springer
programme.desc: John está siendo infiel a su esposa Destinee con Cici, pero Cici también tiene algunos secretos. Entonces, Lala suelta un bombazo a su novio. Además, Michael y su esposa Tayliana tienen secretos que revelarse mutuamente.

programme.title: El show de Jerry Springer

programme.desc: Paulina offers the girls advice on how to successfully model with a variety of items, including fish and toilet paper.

programme.desc: It's training and steel weapons taking on brute force when a Shaolin monk and Maori warrior face-off with twin hooks, a stingray spear, Emei piercers and much more.

programme.title: Deadliest Warrior
programme.desc: Scottish rebel William Wallace takes on African warlord Shaka Zulu in a showdown of weaponry that includes the Claymore sword, Iklwa spear, Targe shield and spit of poison.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Winter arrives in full force, and the remaining survivors must deal with rapidly deteriorating conditions. The lack of protein pushes some to new levels of depletion, and the pull to see family is more than some can bear.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: The remaining survivalists push themselves to their physical limits as fish becomes scarce. But one participant takes it too far, reaching the breaking point and risking organ failure.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths must make their signature blades out of only drill bits and a chunk of mild steel. After two rounds, the remaining two smiths must recreate a deadly Indonesian sword -- the Kelewang.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are forced to make canister Damascus using nuts and bolts. Ultimately, two smiths move on to the final round where they must recreate a pair of deadly Indian Bagh Nakh weapons.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four smiths must forge the iconic KA-BAR military blade using only tiny cubes of W-1 steel. In the final round, the two remaining competitors must recreate the battle-tested Glaive Guisarme.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must forge a multipurpose weapon from old rescue tools. After narrowly escaping elimination, the remaining two smiths must recreate a unique utilitarian tool -- the Russian Pioneer sword.

programme.title: America's Next Top Model
programme.desc: The girls head to Bergdorff’s in New York City for makeovers! After receiving their new looks, the girls do their first photo session with Nigel Barker and must light themselves up.

programme.title: America's Next Top Model
programme.desc: The girls learn runway etiquette with Miss J and walk the runway in a Jill Stuart fashion show. Two previous Top Model contestants surprise the girls and offer runway advice.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: While searching for missing 37-year-old X-ray technician Teddy Cota, the team discovers that Teddy long believed that when he was a child, he was abducted by aliens.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team must determine if a missing nanny is a kidnapping victim or a suspect when she and the infant in her care disappear from her employers' home.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: Lynette Shaw (ELIZABETH BERKLEY), the physically transformed winner of the popular surgical makeover reality show "American Goddess," disappears in the midst of a publicity event.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for Colleen McGrath (AUDREY MARIE ANDERSON), a struggling, young, single mother who vanishes after leaving her 3-year-old son in his baby-sitter's care.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: In a continued effort to find Colleen McGrath, who had recently been recruited as a drug mule, Samantha goes undercover hoping to be approached by the same drug traffickers.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: When a homeless woman goes missing from a shelter, Jack suspects Rick Knowles who manipulated his twin brother, Greg, into confessing to the murders of several other homeless women.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for Peter Dusek (JOSEF SOMMER), a wealthy, 72-year-old murder trial juror, whose disappearance could cause a mistrial.

programme.title: Without A Trace

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for Tara Patterson (MICHELLE HORN), a brilliant 16-year-old private-school student who was last seen by her friends at a bus stop.

programme.title: Without A Trace
programme.desc: While searching for convict James "Mac" MacAvoy, who disappeared during a prison yard fight, the team attempts to determine whether he's an escapee or the victim of an inside plot.
